course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Introduction to International Relations
course.description: This class is designed to introduce representative theories of international relations to students and help them develop an analytical perspective on major issues in international security and international political economy. To this end, the class is divided into three sections. The first section reviews the process of formation and change of the international order, centering on Western Europe, and focusing on important historical events. The second section introduces representative theories that explain international relations, namely, realism, neorealism, liberalism, neoliberalism, Marxism, and constructivism. The third section examines international security, international political economy, and international organizations, human security, the natural environment, terrorism, and human rights.

reviews.author: qqqyo
reviews.title: 西史人應該會ok嘅
reviews.comment_content:
呢個course嘅主旨係:

-教如何用international relationship嘅
理論解釋國際關係/情況

-同埋會教啲西方歷史
例如15-19世紀trading歷史
一戰二戰冷戰21世紀 (now)

btw當佢用1堂教曬一戰+二戰嘅時候見到好多人drop左sls
如果你讀過西史，其實並不可怕的。

1. Explain the main concepts in international relations：aka state/actor/class個啲
2. Explain the key theories in international relations：
Realism/Liberalism/Constructivism/Marxism
3. Analyze international events using diverse theories from international relations; think
analytically about international events

教嘅嘢係有趣嘅
但係上堂好易訓著好易遊魂 (for me)
到呢刻我都唔知講話你地未來讀嘅人應唔應該睇textbook...
mid-term比佢伏左
但係final又冇點出textbook......
可以自行估算一下風險啦
reviews.comment_teaching:
sem頭到sem尾
其實都唔係好聽得明佢嘅口音
有啲簡單嘅theory我係寧願上完堂自己search返算
因為佢嘅英文真係好重韓國口音
有時聽佢講嘢會以為自己聽緊佢講韓文
所以即係聽唔明佢講緊啲咩lol

上Youtube睇片好過上堂聽佢教啲theory
因為佢啲slides冇寫曬重點有啲難跟
同埋佢講嘢有啲慢，會眼訓
reviews.comment_grading:
官方寫法：
A+: 97~ ; A: 93~97; A-: 90~93
B+: 87~90; B: 83~87; B-: 80~83
C+: 77~80; C: 73~77; C-:70~73
D: 60~70; F: ~60

- mid-term個variation超大lmao
但係係每個分數嘅人數分佈都好平均lol
low: 18/100 mean: 58.4/100  high: 85/100
佢話可能40-60幾分會係B to C range
- individual present: 根據我知嘅data, 好多人好高分aka90幾
- 其他暫時未知
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Exam: Mid-term (20%) and final examination (40%): Both exams: a mixture of multiple choice, short answers, and short essays.
-Mid-term：好難
超多題MC, 而每題嘅出法都好難......
佢話出PPT多, 最後好多關textbook事......
而且佢提供嘅textbook chp大多都係scan個類嘅pdf, 冇得search.....
-Final：良心發現變到好易hahaha
都係MC+SQ
MC少左好多
SQ都還好，總之佢上堂有emphasise嘅嘢自己醒水啦

2. In-class pop quiz (10%):
cancel左然後個10%好似後來比左去individual present

3. Presentation: individual presentation (10%) and group presentation (20%)
individual個個我諗大家嘅程度差唔多
group個個：隊友很重要
怕同外國人同組嘅快逃hahaha
因為成班我估三分之二都係外國人
尤其係local好怕嘅某啲accent
你地discuss個陣好難避開haha

4. Attendance:
An extra 5% points for perfect attendance after the Add/Drop period：可以唔開cam！

reviews.author: Edmund Wong
reviews.title: NOT a 1000-level course!
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers a wide range of topics. To be honest, they aren't that difficult.
1. Prior to WWI
2. WWI & WWII
3. Cold War
4. After Cold War

5. Realism
6. State Death
7. Liberalism
8. Marxism

9. Wars
10. IPE
11. UN
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Park speaks English with a super-heavy Korean accent. It is hard to understand what she has said. But it is basically impossible to rely only on her notes for revision. Her notes are not well organized.
reviews.comment_grading:
The assessment includes:
1. Two Exams (40%)
2. Pop Quizzes (10%)
3. INDIVIDUAL Presentation (30%)
4. Discussion (20%)
5. Class attendance and participation (Extra)

The exams and quizzes are quite difficult. You will not expect to come across this level of difficulty in other 1000-level courses.

Professor Park gives the discussion grade ONLY based on her observation during in-class discussions. The discussion topics are often difficult. Do not take this course if you are not confident enough to perform well in this part.

This course uses the absolute grading system.
reviews.comment_workload: It takes only around 1-2 days to complete the revision for each exam. But it takes much longer to complete the individual presentation.
